page.title: 03WILDLIFE IN SOUTH EDINBURGH
page.content: The SOUTH EDINBURGH area is not very well known for its wildlife as much as it is for its upmarket residential areas.People don't realize how much of it there is. For example the Braid & Hermitage is full of wildlife with some people even seeing foxes. {Rabbits}are probably the most common animal around these parts. Sometimes you may see an unusual bird or animal such as goldcrest. The{grey squirrel } is another common animal that lives around here - you will hardly ever see a red squirrel. Coots and moorhens as well as ducks and geese live on the few ponds in the area. Gulls gather in large numbers on the Filter Beds for the water supply. With its hills, golf courses and woods there are plenty of good places for wildlife to exist yet be seen by us city folk.
